title.narrative: Pilot SolaMix Buoy to control toxic algae and stratification in USA lakes

description.narrative: • Short general project overviewThe SolaMix Buoy pilot project will take place in the USA where American Water is the largest public provider of water and waste water services. American Water provides water utility services to customers in the residential commercial, industrial and other sectors. AW also has waste water customers and other utility customers. AW’s primary source of raw water is through reservoirs, rivers and lakes. The AW waterbodies are frequently suffering from the effects of toxic and harmful algae blooms (HABs) and increased BOD resulting in taste and odour issues, increased ammonium concentrations and other quality related issues. State regulations are forcing local operators to move away from the addition of copper sulphate to reduce these issues. Therefore, American Water is searching for environmentally friendly solutions to mitigate these problems. The SolaMix Buoy offers this solution, in line with increasingly stricter rules and regulations of the USA.Common in the USA is that water facility companies have the right to use the lakes and/or reservoirs for raw water and the obligation to keep the water quality in the lake up to standards. However, they do not own nor have rights to use the land surrounding it. Mixing water to mitigate and reduce the described issues is a very effective solution but is currently done through a mixing installation having its energy source on land. Considering the high power consumption of these devices, the on-shore installation of an electricity building or generator is necessary, but often not possible due to restricted access to the land surrounding the lake. This makes the installation of efficient mixers in USA lakes expensive in operation, often unpractical and in many cases even impossible.Hence, this project provides a solution of an off-the-grid modular mixer, powered by solar energy that can be stored in a battery. Furthermore, the solution monitors water quality of the lake and will only start mixing when the oxygen levels at a specific lake/reservoir area are too low. It is energy sufficient as it doesn’t need to mix when it is not necessary and because it uses renewable energy that can be stored and used when the energy source is unavailable, i.e. at night.Next to an energy sufficient innovation being off-grid and therefore does not require a land station for its energy, it is also a modular system. As it is forbidden in the USA to do maintenance on the water body due to the risk of spillage of fluids such as gearbox oil and grease, the project focuses on the development of a system that can be taken apart on water and repaired on land.• Initial activities and results of the projectThe aim of this project is to successfully pilot our off the grid, modular and solar powered mixing buoy. After a test case with positive results, the market in the USA and beyond will be easier to access as we will pioneer with this energy sufficient and easy installable and maintained system.
